title: Module - Discography
description:
Includes the following tracks:

Demo 2006
01 Module - The Prisoner
02 Module - Johnny Who
03 Module - Voice On The Radio
04 Module - Spin The Wheel Of Time
05 Module - Jetplane To Monaco
06 Module - Money For Nothing (Dire Straits Cover)

Throw It At The Wall 2007
01 Module - Throw It At The Wall
02 Module - Running Away
03 Module - Burn
04 Module - Rollin&#039; Rock
05 Module - Take A Dive

Module was formed in 2005 by the brothers Anders and 
Olle Lejon and their friends Jonas Lindgren and Henrik
Myntti. They come from JÃƒÂ¶nkÃƒÂ¶ping, Sweden, which is the place
were most of their gigs take place.

They started rehearsing their songs and after a while
they got their first gig at "Nordisk GÃƒÂ¥rdsbandsfestival"
in JÃƒÂ¶nkÃƒÂ¶ping. The first gig was followes by a few months
without any gigs. At their next gig they introduced some
new songs. 

Module&#039;s first demo was recorded in February 2006. The
tape included four songs. "The Prisoner", "Johnny Who",
"Voice on the Radio" and "Spin the Wheel of Time".
Later that year came an extended version of "Voice on the
Radio", the new songs "Jetplane to Monaco" and "Pulse".

A short time after the performance at "Ung Kraft 2006" Henrik
Myntti decided to leave the band. Although being one band-
member short Module managed to maintain their sound.
In 2006 the number of gigs increased and kept increasing 
even more during 2007. 

2008 started with a release of their new demo "Throw it at the
Wall" including "Burn", "Running Away", "Take A Dive", "Rollin&#039;
Rock" and the titletrack(??) "Throw it at the Wall". 
Unfortunatley they did not have enough time in the studio to
make "Opportunity Goes Away" justice. We will just have to wait
and see if it appears on their next demo or if the next one will
be filled with the new songs they are working at.

Hopefully 2008 will be a good year for Module with a lot more
gigs than 2007. Module&#039;s reputation has increased over the years
which easily could be seen by looking at the larger crouds at
their gigs with "vÃƒÂ¤tterfesten 2007" as their most outstanding
performance.
